intro: Bubon peucedanifolium, commonly known as the false angel's trumpet, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its large, showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant has finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. It is native to South America and thrives in temperate climates. Due to its toxic properties, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant but requires careful handling.
